intro: Lepideilema lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisies, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Lepideilema lancifolium is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and floral display.
